metadata.Title: CVE-2023-2269 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A denial of service problem was found, due to a possible recursive locking scenario, resulting in a deadlock in table_clear in drivers/md/dm-ioctl.c in the Linux Kernel Device Mapper-Multipathing sub-component. Zheng Zhang discovered that the device-mapper implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly handle locking during table_clear() operations. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (kernel deadlock).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-2269` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-27-generic - 6.2.0-27.28
linux-image-6.2.0-27-generic-lpae - 6.2.0-27.28
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-27-generic - 6.2.0-27.28
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-27-generic-64k - 6.2.0-27.28
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1009-aws - 6.2.0-1009.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-27.28').
linux-allwinner: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needed').
